selected_quotes: Dental ontogeny in late Miocene hipparionines from the Lamagou fauna of Fugu, Shaanxi Province, China
Assessment of dental ontogeny in late Miocene hipparionines from Shaanxi Province, China (OA) - v
So great to see studies using eruption and wear- selection acts on both!

citation.abstract: A collection of 28 hipparionine skull and mandible fossils with a dated age of approximately 7.4 Ma from Fugu, Shaanxi, northwestern China (belonging to Hipparion chiai and Hipparion cf. coelophyes) shows an age distribution in a successive development sequence. By observing the dentitions in these fossil materials, knowledge of dental ontogeny has been gained, such as the opening time of the posterior wall of post-fossettes, the displacement of the plis hypostyle, the morphologic changes of the protocone and hypocone, etc. Additionally, 4 isolated maxillary cheek teeth and 2 mandibular cheek teeth were cut into slices in the traditional manner for authentication. These discoveries indicate that both of the hipparionine species in the Lamagou fauna are Hipparion cf. chiai exactly and offer further insight into the morphologic changes that occur during dental wear in hipparionines, which may greatly promote the morphological and taxonomic study of hipparionine species.
citation.title: Assessment of dental ontogeny in late Miocene hipparionines from the Lamagou fauna of Fugu, Shaanxi Province, China

author.name: PLOS Paleo Community
author.description: PLOS Paleo, a community for and by researchers in paleontology & related fields. Tweets by @AndyFarke, Jon Tennant @protohedgehog & Sarah Gibson @gombessagirl

author.name: Andrew A. Farke
author.description: Paleontologist, educator, open science advocate, homebrewer. I blog about homebrewing at https://t.co/s6yZ1yx1W0 and paleontology at: https://t.co/024f4xpHkW

author.name: Robert Boessenecker
author.description: Ph.D. in paleontology with focus on marine mammals, artist, Adjunct Lecturer at @cofc; studying Oligocene whaleontology @cofcnathistory

author.name: Advait Jukar
author.description: Macroecologist, paleontologist, biogeographer. South Asia and Proboscideans. Doctoral candidate at George Mason University, Reed College alumnus. Tweets my own.

author.name: Ben Grace
author.description: Palaeo cat, & general science man. Likes a spot of history, fossil hunting & rock music. Hoping to do a palaeo-PhD if somebody will fund & supervise me.

author.name: Christine Böhmer
author.description: Palaebiologist. Tweeting on research in #Palaeontology #VertebrateEvolution Evolutionary Developmental Biology (#EvoDevo) #functionalmorphology #anatomy.

wikipedia.title: 2017 in mammal paleontology
wikipedia.summary: This article records new taxa of fossil mammals of every kind that have been described during the year 2017, as well as other significant discoveries and events related to paleontology of mammals that occurred in the year 2017.
